result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lance D Martin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lance D Martin in court.  Attorney Justin Padway in court for Lance D Martin.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense received discovery and offer; defense provided State with discovery and requested a status conference date. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16; IN PERSON. Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
This case was set in Branch 16 20 10/17 at 1:30 by prelim court. This date does not work for the court so this case is being adjourned to 10/21 at 1:30. Parties notified.

Defendant Lance D Martin appeared by video.  Attorney Justin Padway appeared by video for Lance D Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of 08CF5340. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer B. Duerst. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lance D Martin appeared by video.  Attorney Justin Padway appeared by video for Lance D Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's witnesses are not present. One officer is on a homicide call and unable to appear. Second officer is on vacation and did not receive a subpoena. Defense Counsel motions to dismiss. Court acknowledges the motion. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lance D Martin in court with Attorney Justin Padway; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present; it's the officers day off. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. Remaining cash bail to be returned to remitter. 
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lance D Martin in court with attorney Justin Padway.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Payable Number: 1019505,
Receipt Number: 22RP028314,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/25/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7-25-2022 @1p
